> <OLD>
>
> Nightshift sits forward in his chair with a grin on his face.
>
> " Now that's a good question.  And I got a story ta tell that might answer
> it for ya.  One time, Master Yokitron was holding some basic training in
> Ninjabot combat, and Rodimus, who is already an established hot shot
> warrior, was attending one of those training exercises.  At the same time,
> so was Tucson, who actually continued his Ninjabot training, shortly after
> the brief session he attended.  Okay, gett'n back ta the story, Rodimus
> didn't pay too much attention ta Master Yokitron and never went on with the
> training.  He was kinda not with it and liked his warrior style of fighting
> a lot better. Well, Master Yokitron wanted ta see just how important his
> training was and asked him ta spar with me.  I said okay and I did as
> Yokitron asked.  Wouldn't ya know, I had Rodimus knocked off his feet in the
> first ten minutes of the first session?  He's an awesome fighter as a knight
> but it didn't serve him too well going up against a Ninja.  Warriors are
> smart, strong and steadfast.  A Ninja is smart, swift, strong, and
> dexterous.  A perfect balance of skill and agility."  I hope that clears
> things up for ya."
>

<NEW>

WOLFGANG gave NIGHTSHIFT his full attention while the story was told,
leaning back in his chair as the story spun to an end.

"Hot Shot, an established warrior by that time?" That comment coming
not from WOLFGANG but from PROWL. "No, that was not the case. Hot Shot
may have fancied himself to be one but he had not the training or
expireince to be called that."

There was an eager nod from WOLFGANG, "A sword is no better than a
mace on the field of battle." WOLFGANG said comparing a knight to a
ninja with weaoons they may carry. "Only the skill behind them and the
strength that wields them determines the outcome."

WOLFGANG gestured at NIGHTSHIFT, "You have been trained to be a ninja,
and your training has afforded you certain skills and you have focused
on your craft and you may have succeeded." He shrugged slightly as he
said the last.

"But a punch is still a punch and a sword thrust is still a thrust and
they can all be fatal if done right. The ninja and the knight are only
as good as their training and to assume that either one is as good or
better on the battlefield just because one has had a different
training or title then the other is . . . " He smiled again as he
gestured lazilly in the air, "Now that would be the hight of
foolishness."

As WOLFGANG came to an end the ship touched down, the cabin jostled
only slightly. Judging from the silence of the others this was a
conversation they have all had with WOLFGANG at one time or another.

"All right let's disembark!" POLAR CLAW said as the shuttle door began
to open and a ramp extend down. "Keep your optics on full and your
weapons at the ready!"

(TAG)

Preston
